name: kaab ghzal
ingredients: For the dough: 250 g of flour
For the filling (almond paste): 200 g of ground almonds
steps: Prepare the dough: Mix the flour, melted butter, and salt. Add the lukewarm water, orange blossom water, sugar, and egg. Knead to obtain a smooth dough. Cover and let rest.

Prepare the filling: Blend the blanched almonds into a powder. Add the sugar, melted butter, orange blossom water, cinnamon, and gum arabic (if used). Mix until a soft paste is obtained. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Shape into small logs (20 to 25 g each).

Shaping: Roll out the dough very thinly with a rolling pin. Place a log of almond filling in the center. Fold the dough over the filling. Cut with a fluted pastry wheel and shape into a crescent (horn) by pinching the top ridge.
Prick each crescent with a needle. Let dry for several hours (at least 10 hours).
Brush with clarified melted butter. Bake in a preheated oven at 150Â°C for 10-12 minutes (they should remain light in color).
Sprinkle with powdered sugar after baking. Store in an airtight container.
